CEO.name: Angelina Biviana Riveiro Disla
CEO.title: Executive Director of the Export and Investment Center of the Dominican Republic
CEO.about: Bachelor of Law with Magna Cum Laude honors from the Pontifical Catholic University Mother and Teacher PUCMM, Santo Domingo in 2002.
CEO.description: We want our exporters to also have trade facilitation services through participation in fairs and trade missions around the world, business rounds with international buyers, and productive chain agendas.

data.desc: Graduated from the Dominican College of La Salle in 1998 and in Law, with Magna Cum Laude honors from the Pontifical Catholic University Mother and Teacher PUCMM, Santo Domingo in 2002.

She has taken numerous national and international courses at institutions such as the World Trade Organization, the International Telecommunication Union, and holds the following master's degrees, postgraduate degrees, and diplomas: Master of Business Law and Postgraduate in Economics for Business; Corporate Governance and Boards of Directors Program and Persuasive Leadership from Wharton Executive Education at the University of Pennsylvania; Certification from the International Centre For Parliamentary Studies (ICPS), United Kingdom in Investment and International Trade; Diplomas in International Law, Intellectual Property, Banking Law, Administrative Law, Arbitration, as well as other courses sponsored by various local and foreign universities.
She began her legal work in 2000, when she worked as a Paralegal and later as an Associate Researcher at the Institutionalism and Justice Foundation (FINJUS) until 2003.

She served as Legal Advisor to the Regulatory Policies Management and Legal Advisor to the International Affairs Management of the Dominican Institute of Telecommunications (INDOTEL), where she participated in the elaboration and revision of regulations and norms related to the telecommunications sector, handling issues such as information society, electronic commerce, and high-tech crimes; and represented the institution at events and before international organizations such as the International Telecommunication Union (ITU); the Inter-American Telecommunication Commission of the OAS (CITEL); REGULATEL, among other organizations. She also worked as a Lawyer at the law firm, Melo Guerrero Office (OMG), developing her practice in the field of corporate law.

From 2006 to 2011, she served as Executive Director of the National Association of Young Entrepreneurs (ANJE), becoming a member of the Board of Directors in 2012 and President of said entity in October 2014 until October 2015. From this entity, she promoted institutionalism, entrepreneurship, and innovation in the country.

In 2010, she founded the legal and business consulting firm Grupo Legalia, where she practiced law in its various specialized areas, specializing in civil and commercial law, telecommunications, film, energy, competition and consumer law, civil aviation and intellectual property, investment, and foreign trade.

In August 2016, she joined the management of former mayor David Collado as Legal Director and Secretary General at the National District City Council where she worked on modernization processes, transparency, simplification of processes in urban planning, regulatory reforms for transit, Territorial Planning Plan, Citizen Security Plan, and the innovative rapid response center for citizen demands.

On August 16, 2020, by Decree 329-20 of President Luis Rodolfo Abinader, she was appointed as Executive Director with ministerial rank of the Export and Investment Center of the Dominican Republic (ProDominicana), from where she has promoted the development of the export sector and the volume of exports as well as the attraction of investment with unprecedented records for the Dominican Republic, being the agency recognized as one of the best in innovative services with the award of the Annual Investment Meeting of 2022 as well as its role in supporting the promotion of exports by the Dominican Exporters Association (Adoexpo).

She has been a university lecturer and representative on various councils in the business field. She has received various awards for her professional and social trajectory, including awards for Social Market (2015); recognition in the framework of the National Youth Award of the Dominican Republic, in the category of Overcoming, Personal Achievements, and Business Development, Ministry of Youth (2015); by the National Council of Social Security, for her contributions and work as a member of the Council representing the employer sector (2013); by the National Association of Young Entrepreneurs for her contributions to the country (2010); awarded at the XXXVII Outstanding Youth Awards of 2009 of the Dominican Republic by Jaycees 72 (2010); recognition from the Chamber of Commerce and Production of Santo Domingo for her participation in the General Law of Commercial Companies and Individual Limited Liability Companies (2009).

whoarewe.title: Who Are We?
whoarewe.desc: We are the Center for the Promotion of Exports and Investments in the country, responsible for promoting our products, services, and business opportunities worldwide.

mission.title: Mission
mission.desc: Promote the exportable offer and investment opportunities to attract FDI, contributing to sustainable economic development and positioning the Dominican Republic as a leading business destination in the region.

vision.title: Vision
vision.desc: To be the leading agency in the region for the promotion and encouragement of exports and investments, recognized as the strategic partner par excellence for both the public and private sectors in generating sustainable and innovative business.

qualityPolicy.title: Quality Policy
qualityPolicy.desc: The Export and Investment Center of the Dominican Republic (ProDominicana) maintains a strong commitment to the country's development by promoting increased exports and foreign direct investment through comprehensive services that meet the needs of exporters, potential exporters, foreign investors, and the general public. Always adhering to the highest standards of excellence and quality, the organization promotes continuous improvement of its processes and compliance with current laws and regulations.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.desc: We put all our effort into doing our work in the best possible way to remain a model institution.

teamWork.title: Teamwork
teamWork.desc: We believe that our work is enriched, and our services improve when we share value and information as a team.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.desc: We are driven by love for public service, and therefore, we act correctly, adhering to the law and ethical values.

efficiency.title: Efficiency
efficiency.desc: We optimize available resources to provide services in the shortest time and with the highest possible quality.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.desc: Keeping our word and consistency in actions are important parts of our business dealings. Therefore, we nurture professional and investment relationships by generating trust.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.desc: We work with openness and transparency so that our work can be scrutinized and recognized, ensuring trust.

serviceVocation.title: Service Vocation
serviceVocation.desc: We believe in public service. We diligently and timely attend to the requirements of our internal and external clients.

proactivity.title: Proactivity
proactivity.desc: We anticipate, manage, understand, and meet customer expectations based on proposed objectives to ensure success.

equity.title: Equity
equity.desc: We act fairly with our clients, regardless of economic, social, political, and gender conditions, respecting and serving all human beings equally.

info.description: On June 17, 2003, the merger of CEDOPEX and OPI-RD gave rise to the creation of the Center for Export and Investment of the Dominican Republic (CEI-RD) through Law 98-03, under the mandate of former President Hipólito Mejía, with the main objective of promoting and fostering Dominican exports.

Since 2012, after the formation of the Multisectoral Commission through decree NO. 22-12, CEI-RD was designated for the development of the Dominican Republic Country Brand to lay the groundwork and articulate a comprehensive strategic plan, with Colombia serving as the advisory country.

ProDominicana is created, by decree 275-17, as a mechanism for coordinating and executing the plans of the Dominican state with the process of implementing a National Export and Investment Promotion strategy. As well as a denomination that clearly identifies the Dominican Republic with the development of its export promotion and investment attraction activities.

The first Women in Export Meeting was held in 2020, during which the Women in Export Study was launched to eliminate gender gaps as a strategy to promote greater participation of women in productive and commercial activities; it seeks to generate more employment and a sustainable economic development scheme. In 2024, we held the 4th edition.

Presentation of the “National Export Promotion Plan of the Dominican Republic PNFE-RD 2020–2030” which has been formulated in a consensual and coherent manner, to guarantee the boost of exports, connecting with policies in favor of productive development. As well as the joint work of the institutions that impact the export process to address short, medium, and long-term challenges that allow the country's participation in international trade.

Launch of the first Foreign Investment Guide in English and Spanish, aimed at providing basic information for the development of investments and businesses in the country, as well as the opportunities and facilities offered by the Dominican Republic to foreign investors. By 2024, we have the Investment Guide available in 11 languages.

Launch of the Export Guide, which is a summary that presents the most important elements that exporters and potential exporters in the country must know and apply in order to successfully develop their export businesses. It is also a highly valuable tool, developed by ProDominicana in favor of Dominican producers and exporters, in compliance with the National Export Promotion Plan (PNFE) and the commercial promotion strategy outlined by President Luis Abinader's Government.
Presentation of the first Fashion Study in the Dominican Republic with the aim of creating a Commercial Promotion Plan to stimulate exports from the fashion industry.

Implementation of the Single Investment Window (VUIRD) system, which aims to streamline the processes of national and foreign investments that intend to develop operations in the country's different productive sectors of goods and services, so that the investor has a single point of contact, more efficient with less bureaucracy.

In 2023, ProDominicana carried out 17 institutional agreements with the purpose of establishing provincial offices with the presence of Regional Executives from ProDominicana to contribute to the achievement of the goals and objectives of promoting exports and attracting investments. The provinces where the institution is present are: Bonao, La Vega, San Cristóbal, Samaná, La Altagracia, Pedernales, La Romana, Puerto Plata, Espaillat, Peravia, Miches, El Seibo, Hermanas Mirabal, Hato Mayor, Constanza, San Juan, and Santiago.

home.title: Empowering Women in E-commerce
home.desc: Join the International Trade Centre's (ITC) virtual learning program to venture into e-commerce and expand your online sales channels nationally and internationally.

about.title: About the Program
about.desc: The SheTrades initiative, along with the ecomConnect program of the International Trade Centre, aims to empower women-led businesses to sell their products online and access domestic and international markets through training with virtual resources, continuous support, and access to an entrepreneurial community for networking and sharing experiences.

list.name: Adoption of International Certifications in Agro-exports
Creating Spaces for Women Exporters and Aspiring Exporters
Participation of the Dominican Republic in International Forums on Gender and Trade

list.title: Integration into the SheTrades Hub International Network
list.desc: SheTrades facilitates the possibility for women entrepreneurs to connect with female entrepreneurs from other countries, creating an ideal space to share experiences and learn from effective business development practices. Likewise, it allows business support institutions to share initiatives, projects, and programs to support women in international trade.

list.title: Access to Tools and Resources
list.desc: ITC offers various tools to facilitate women's participation in the international market and identify potential opportunities; similarly, it produces reports detailing the importance of promoting women's economic empowerment, gender-sensitive public procurement, investment facilitation, gender mainstreaming in trade agreements and trade policies, including recommendations to countries and multilateral trade-related organizations.

list.title: Capacity Development
list.desc: SheTrades provides exclusive access to training and virtual training programs focused on skill development, digital tool management, competitiveness, enterprise risk management, export readiness, and market intelligence and sustainability tools. The Hubs disseminate these training programs to women-led companies in their countries. In addition to this, through the SheTrades Academy42 web portal, women entrepreneurs can access multiple free asynchronous programs on the international business environment, value chains, competitiveness, export markets, e-commerce to sell their products online, export procedures; also providing the opportunity to use self-assessment tools to diagnose training needs, as well as risk assessment and crisis management methods in their businesses.

list.title: Business Activity Development
list.desc: Through the Hubs, SheTrades channels support and guidance to women-led companies from different countries for their participation in regional and international trade fairs and missions, fostering the creation of commercial opportunities.

list.title: Access to Financing
list.desc: The SheTrades initiative enables entrepreneurs from developing countries to access information about available financing opportunities through the SheTrades Invest project, which includes events, activities, and an online platform (https://shetradesinvest.converve.io/) to connect women-led businesses or SMEs that benefit eligible women, with capital providers.

why.description: The Dominican Republic offers multiple investment opportunities as a result of a wide variety of factors that have increased competitiveness, making it a comprehensive destination for businesses.

reasons.title: Strategic geographical location.
reasons.description: Its location, in the heart of the Caribbean, has made the Dominican Republic an important commercial hub between Europe, North America, and the rest of Latin America, offering preferential access to over 1.2 billion consumers through free trade agreements with the United States and Central America, via DR-CAFTA, and with the European Union, through the Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA).

reasons.title: Solid legal framework and incentives.
reasons.description: The Dominican Republic has a government that favors foreign direct investment (FDI) through a solid legal framework, which not only provides legal security to investors but also offers a set of incentives and tax exemptions that guarantee greater profitability to their investments, while generating decent jobs, boosting the economy, and promoting the country's development.

reasons.title: Advanced infrastructure.
reasons.description: The country has extensive, developed physical infrastructure tailored to the requirements of a society focused on the production and marketing of goods and services. Its road network is one of the best in the region, linking virtually all destinations in the country. It also has modern, extensive, and efficient airport and port systems. According to the latest Global Competitiveness Report 2019-2020 by the World Economic Forum, the country ranks first in the region in transport infrastructure, standing out for connectivity and the quality of its road network. Additionally, its advanced and reliable telecommunications infrastructure is one of its main competitive advantages.

reasons.title: Richness and variety of natural resources.
reasons.description: The Dominican Republic combines a diversity of attractive natural resources, such as its beautiful beaches, fertile soils, warm climate, and mineral deposits, making it an ideal place to explore and invest.

reasons.title: Economic, social, and political stability.
reasons.description: Legal security, economic dynamism, and an attractive business climate continue to make the Dominican Republic the preferred destination for attracting Foreign Direct Investment in the region and one of the most vibrant economies in Latin America and the Caribbean.

reasons.title: Human talent.
reasons.description: The Dominican Republic is committed to a future built on competitive human talent, environmental sustainability, and technological innovation as the path to development; thus, ProDominicana is pleased to provide all the collaboration, support, and assistance necessary for the development of your businesses in the country.

sectors.title: Sectors to invest in DR
sectors.description: Sectors representing investment opportunities in the country.

list.name: Tourism
list.description: Explore a leading sector in the region, renowned for its luxury resorts, dreamy beaches, lush landscapes, and an endless list of activities for tourists worldwide. Invest in boutique hotels, sustainable ecotourism, vibrant cultural experiences, or top-notch sports tourism.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Renewable Energy
list.description: Participate in the transformation of the Dominican energy sector towards a sustainable and resilient future. Invest in renewable energy projects such as solar, wind, and hydroelectric energy, infrastructure development for energy generation and distribution, clean and innovative technologies that reduce environmental footprint, and diversification of the country's energy matrix.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Technology
list.description: Take advantage of the technological boom driven by the Special Free Trade Zone Law and the growing demand for digital services. Invest in innovative software companies, cutting-edge mobile application development, state-of-the-art data centers, artificial intelligence solutions revolutionizing industries, and financial technology (fintech) initiatives transforming the banking landscape.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Manufacturing
list.description: Be part of a diversified and constantly growing sector ranging from high-quality textiles and cutting-edge pharmaceutical products to life-saving medical devices, precision electronic components, and a thriving agro-industry. Opportunities include light manufacturing companies, strategic nearshoring to optimize supply chains, and industrial parks with first-class infrastructure.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Semiconductors
list.description: Pioneer in an emerging sector with the installation of the first chip manufacturing plant in the region. Invest in state-of-the-art chip assembly companies, integrated circuit design driving technological innovation, and semiconductor material manufacturing, the fundamental basis of modern electronics.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Agriculture
list.description: Unlock the enormous potential of a sector with fertile lands, an ideal tropical climate, and a growing demand for fresh products in international markets. Invest in technified agriculture that maximizes production, sustainable livestock farming for responsible consumption, organic food production meeting the demands of the most conscious consumers, and modern greenhouses ensuring quality and freshness year-round.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Biomedicine
list.description: Contribute to the well-being of the population and take advantage of the growing demand for quality health services. Invest in medical research paving the way for new discoveries, production of innovative drugs improving people's lives, biotechnology revolutionizing healthcare, and health tourism attracting international patients seeking top-notch treatments.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Film Industry
list.description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant Dominican film industry, which has experienced exponential growth in recent years. Invest in the production of domestic and international films, state-of-the-art recording studios, high-quality post-production services, local talent development, and attractive tax incentives for the industry.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Real Estate
list.description: Take advantage of the boom in the Dominican real estate sector, driven by tourism growth, economic expansion, and housing demand. Invest in hotel construction projects, luxury resorts, apartments, villas, commercial properties, shopping centers, and real estate investments for tourism purposes.

list.name: Equipment, materials, and furniture necessary for initial installations and start-up operations
Employer Registration at the Social Security Treasury
Construction License (Ministry of Housing, Habitat, and Buildings)
Request for Exemption from Import Duties on Construction Goods (MITUR)
Request for Tax Exemption (Ministry of Finance)
